se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.api

Class AbstractSuspendableMBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.management.StandardMBean
      • javax.management.StandardEmitterMBean
        • se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.api.AbstractMBean
          • se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.api.AbstractSuspendableMBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DynamicMBean, MBeanRegistration, NotificationBroadcaster, NotificationEmitter, LifecycleStateful, Suspendable

    public abstract class AbstractSuspendableMBean
extends AbstractMBean
implements Suspendable
    Abstract implementation of a Suspendable AbstractMBean, sporting LifecycleState validation for the suspend and resume methods.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSuspendableMBean

        protected AbstractSuspendableMBean(Class<?> mbeanInterface,
                                   NotificationEmitter delegate)

        Convenience constructor, creating a new AbstractMBean wrapping the supplied data. All NotificationEmitter operations executed in this AbstractMBean are delegated to the provided NotificationEmitter object. Thus, all JMX notifications fired by this AbstractMBean are simply delegated to the supplied NotificationEmitter.

        This constructor must be called from a subclass that implements the provided mbeanInterface.

        Parameters:
        mbeanInterface - a StandardMBean interface.
        delegate - A non-null NotificationEmitter to which this AbstractMBean will delegate all NotificationEmitter operations.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the mbeanInterface does not follow JMX design patterns for Management Interfaces, or if this does not implement the specified interface, or if delegate is null.
        See Also:
        StandardEmitterMBean.StandardEmitterMBean(Class, boolean, javax.management.NotificationEmitter)

      • AbstractSuspendableMBean

        protected AbstractSuspendableMBean(Class<?> mbeanInterface,
                                   boolean isMXBean,
                                   NotificationEmitter delegate)

        Creates an AbstractMBean with the management interface mbeanInterface, and where notifications are handled by the given NotificationEmitter. This constructor can be used to make either Standard MBeans or MXBeans. The resultant MBean implements the NotificationEmitter interface by forwarding its methods to delegate.

        If delegate is an instance of NotificationBroadcasterSupport then the MBean's NotificationBroadcasterSupport.sendNotification(Notification) method will delegate its invocation to delegate.NotificationBroadcasterSupport.sendNotification(Notification).

        The array returned by StandardEmitterMBean.getNotificationInfo() on the new MBean is a copy of the array returned by emitter.NotificationBroadcaster.getNotificationInfo() at the time of construction. If the array returned by emitter.getNotificationInfo() later changes, that will have no effect on this object's getNotificationInfo().

        This constructor must be called from a subclass that implements the given mbeanInterface.

        Parameters:
        mbeanInterface - a StandardMBean interface.
        isMXBean - If true, the mbeanInterface parameter names an MXBean interface and the resultant MBean is an MXBean.
        delegate - A non-null NotificationEmitter to which this AbstractMBean will delegate all NotificationEmitter operations.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the mbeanInterface does not follow JMX design patterns for Management Interfaces, or if this does not implement the specified interface, or if delegate is null.

    • Method Detail

      • suspend

        public final boolean suspend()
                      throws IllegalStateException
        Performs a graceful and synchronous suspension of this Suspendable, implying that any operations invoked within this Suspendable are not executed until the resume method has been called. Calling suspend multiple times should have no effect. When returning from this suspend method, the LifecycleStateful instance should be properly suspended.
        Specified by:
        suspend in interface Suspendable
        Returns:
        true if this Suspendable was successfully suspended when this method has executed, and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this Suspendable was not in state LifecycleStateful.STARTED.

      • resume

        public final boolean resume()
                     throws IllegalStateException
        Specified by:
        resume in interface Suspendable
        Returns:
        true if this Suspendable was successfully resumed when this method has executed, and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this Suspendable was not in state LifecycleStateful.STOPPED.

      • suspendMBeanOperations

        protected abstract boolean suspendMBeanOperations()
        Implement this method to define what should be done to suspend (operations within) this MBean. Invoked from the suspend() method; this method should not throw Exceptions.
        Returns:
        true if this AbstractSuspendableMBean was successfully suspended, and false otherwise.

      • resumeMBeanOperations

        protected abstract boolean resumeMBeanOperations()
        Implement this method to define what should be done to resume (operations within) this MBean. Invoked from the resume() method; this method should not throw Exceptions.
        Returns:
        true if this AbstractSuspendableMBean was successfully resumed, and false otherwise.

      • getSuspendResumeFilter

        public static AttributeChangeNotificationFilter getSuspendResumeFilter()
        Returns:
        An AttributeChangeNotificationFilter which will listen only to state change events emitted by an AbstractSuspendableMBean subclass (e.g. AttributeChangeEvent with attributeName set to the value of constants SUSPENDED_ATTRIBUTENAME or RESUMED_ATTRIBUTENAME).
